basic_data.Description: APPLICATION PURPOSE: THE PROJECT WILL BE USED BY ASUCD-UNITRANS (WHICH IS A UNIT OF THE UNIVERSITY OF CALIFORNIA DAVIS AND SUB-RECIPIENT TO THE CITY OF DAVIS PROVIDING TRANSIT SERVICE FOR THE CITY OF DAVIS AND UC DAVIS) AND BY THE CITY OF DAVIS (FOR PARATRANSIT SERVICE).A MINIMUM OF ONE PERCENT OF FTA SECTION 5307 FUNDS OBLIGATED IN THIS GRANT WILL BE USED FOR TRANSIT SECURITY ACTIVITIES INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO IMPROVED FACILITY/FLEET SECURITY AND VIDEO SURVEILLANCE UPGRADES.; ACTIVITIES PERFORMED: FUNDS FROM THIS AWARD WILL BE USED TO COVER A PORTION OF OPERATING EXPENSES FOR UNITRANS FIXED ROUTE TRANSIT SERVICES FOR FISCAL YEARS 2021 2023 AND 2024. IN ADDITION FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR ROLLING STOCK REPLACEMENT FOR BOTH DAVIS COMMUNITY TRANSIT AND UNITRANS IMPROVEMENTS TO THE UNITRANS MAINTENANCE FACILITY TO FACILITATE THE CONTINUED REPLACEMENT OF UNITRANS CNG BUSES WITH ELECTRIC-BATTERY BUSES PURCHASE OF NEW AND REPLACEMENT EQUIPMENT USED TO OPERATE AND MAINTAIN UNITRANS SERVICES REPLACEMENT OF OLD INFORMATION MANAGEMENT SYSTEMS AND PREPARATION OF AN UPDATED SHORT RANGE TRANSIT PLAN FOR CITY OF DAVIS FIXED-ROUTE AND PARATRANSIT SERVICES.; EXPECTED OUTCOMES: EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE CONTINUITY OF FIXED ROUTE TRANSIT SERVICE IMPROVED SYSTEM RELIABILITY IMPROVED EFFICIENCY REDUCED OPERATING AND MAINTENANCE COSTS AND COMPLIANCE WITH ELECTRIC CONVERSION REGULATIONS.; INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE RESIDENTS AND VISITORS TO THE CITY OF DAVIS THE UNIVERSITY OF CALIFORNIA-DAVIS AND TRANSIT CUSTOMERS WHO WILL BENEFIT FROM CONTINUED SERVICE THAT IS RELIABLE AND MORE SUSTAINABLE.; SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: ALL ACTIVITIES EXCEPT FOR PARATRANSIT VEHICLE REPLACEMENTS WILL BE UNDERTAKEN BY THE CITYS SUB-RECIPIENT THE REGENTS OF THE UNIVERSITY OF CALIFORNIA-DAVIS THROUGH ITS OPERATING UNIT ASUCD-UNITRANS.
